medical_history.chief_complaint: Angina pectoris and left main coronary artery disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mrs D experienced infrequent episodes of angina pectoris for several years, with recent symptoms becoming more intermittent and rapidly responsive to nitroglycerin. Notably, she had a history of chest pain and transient symptoms that evolved over decades, including a significant event that led to cardiac catheterization which revealed 60% to 70% stenosis of the left main coronary artery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Has a 35-year history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and a long-standing use of statins. Past surgical history includes total abdominal hysterectomy for a fibroid uterus, appendectomy, and several episodes of small-bowel obstruction, one of which was complicated by pulmonary embolism.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of coronary artery disease; her father died before 50 from an acute myocardial infarction.
medical_history.social_history: Retired from business, stopped smoking 40 years ago after a 36 pack-year history, does not drink alcohol, does not actively exercise, and has expressed skepticism about beginning an exercise regimen.
